description: The parameter `nneighbors` wasn't passed to the next level in the original code, which I think is a bug. `nneighbors` is contained in the dictionary `kwargs` when it is not `None` (the default value). Here I simply pass `kwargs` to the next level, which shall solve the problem.
title: Fix a parameter passing problem

content.raw: I'm wondering if it will be better (or worse) to change the default value to be `nneighbors=64` instead of `nneighbors=None` and simply pass it on?
content.html: I'm wondering if it will be better (or worse) to change the default value to be nneighbors=64 instead of nneighbors=None and simply pass it on?

content.raw: That seems clearer. I also think the kawrgs dict is unnecessary.
content.html: That seems clearer. I also think the kawrgs dict is unnecessary.

content.raw: Okay, I'm going to refactor that.
Something went wrong, you should checkout https://tests.yt-project.org/job/yt_testsuite_dev/1178/
I tried but I couldn't figure out what might have caused the problem.
content.html: I tried but I couldn't figure out what might have caused the problem.

content.raw: Something went wrong, you should checkout https://tests.yt-project.org/job/yt_testsuite_dev/1180/
I'm not sure why this only fails for OWLS, as far as I'm aware that frontend doesn't specify any special number of nearest neighbors.
content.html: I'm not sure why this only fails for OWLS, as far as I'm aware that frontend doesn't specify any special number of nearest neighbors.

content.raw: That's exactly what I was thinking. I also observe that all and only the `'gas'` fields fail. Maybe that tells something?
content.html: That's exactly what I was thinking. I also observe that all and only the 'gas' fields fail. Maybe that tells something?

content.raw: Yes, the `'gas'` fields are SPH smoothed fields, which would definitely pass through the code path you changed. I'm just confused why differences only manifested for OWLS and not the other SPH codes we run answer tests for (Gadget, Tipsy).
content.html: Yes, the 'gas' fields are SPH smoothed fields, which would definitely pass through the code path you changed. I'm just confused why differences only manifested for OWLS and not the other SPH codes we run answer tests for (Gadget, Tipsy).

content.raw:
It turns out the OWLS frontend needs `nneighbors=48`, and explicitly sets that in `yt/frontends/OWLS/fields.py`. This gets passed through the `setup_particle_fields` function, which then somehow comes into the function you've modified here.

If you can try to trace through how the OWLS `num_neighbors` is getting set as `nneighbors` here, that should allow you to fix this, I think.
content.html:
It turns out the OWLS frontend needs nneighbors=48, and explicitly sets that in yt/frontends/OWLS/fields.py. This gets passed through the setup_particle_fields function, which then somehow comes into the function you've modified here.

If you can try to trace through how the OWLS num_neighbors is getting set as nneighbors here, that should allow you to fix this, I think.

content.raw: Oh I see. I'll have a look at that.
content.html: Oh I see. I'll have a look at that.

content.raw: I'm suspecting it's the other way. So previously, `num_neighbors` was passed to `add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field`, but it's not passed to `data.smooth`. Now, it is actually passed to `data.smooth`, which makes a difference. But I'm not sure if we should change `num_neighbors=48` to `num_neighbors=64` or change the answer tests instead?
content.html: I'm suspecting it's the other way. So previously, num_neighbors was passed to add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field, but it's not passed to data.smooth. Now, it is actually passed to data.smooth, which makes a difference. But I'm not sure if we should change num_neighbors=48 to num_neighbors=64 or change the answer tests instead?

content.raw: Probably we should change the answers if it's now working as intended. Can you verify that using one of our public test OWLS datasets and a debugger?
content.html: Probably we should change the answers if it's now working as intended. Can you verify that using one of our public test OWLS datasets and a debugger?

content.raw: Sure, I'll have a look at that.
content.html: Sure, I'll have a look at that.

content.raw: What I need to check is that `nneighbors == 48` within `add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field`, right?
content.html: What I need to check is that nneighbors == 48 within add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field, right?

content.raw:
I used a simple print within `add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field` to test it, and all `nneighbors == 48`.

content.html: I used a simple print within add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field to test it, and all nneighbors == 48.

content.html: Sounds good, in that case the answers just need to be regenerated.
